oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lawyers going to court
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: civil rights; Lawson, James; Young, Andrew; Burch, Lucius; Newman, Charles F.; Cody, W. J. Michael; law;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From left to right: Rev. James Lawson, Andrew Young, Lucius Burch, Charlie Newman and Mike Cody. On April 4, 1968, Rev. Lawson and Andrew Young testified in court in Dr. King's case to overturn the injunction on the sanitation workers' march. The attorneys from Burch, Porter & Johnson represented Dr. King at the request of the ACLU.
